thread.title: Bryant's Paul Calley earns 100th career victory
thread.title_full: Bryant's Paul Calley earns 100th career victory

title: Bryant's Paul Calley earns 100th career victory
text:
Bryant's Paul Calley earns 100th career victory Luke Matheson CLICK HERE TO SUBSCRIBE TO ARKANSASVARSITY.COM - JUST 33 CENTS PER DAY The Bryant Hornets have had a solid season thus far in 2015, winning their first six games of the year. Due to this, head coach Paul Calley earned his 100th career victory Friday night as the Hornets fended off a salty Alma Airedale team 27-24. Currently, Calley's career record sets at 100-39-4. 
Despite the 6-0 record, the Hornets have faces a lot of adversity this year. Just days before a rivalry game against the Benton Panthers in week one, sophomore Ray Davis passed away. However, the Hornets were able to Do It For Ray by earning a 38-13 victory over their arch rival. 
Calley spoke with ArkansasVarsity.com to discuss his 100th victory and more as his team prepares for another tough match up against the Greenwood Bulldogs this Friday night. 
"At the time with it being such a close game, it felt really good," said Calley. "Knowing that we went 6-0 for the first time since 1999 and only the second time in school history, which made it even more special." CLICK HERE TO CONTINUE READING THE STORY
